channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Did Jeffrey Epstein Really Kill Himself?
item.description: Let’s ask questions.

item.title: Farage Warns U.K. Censorship ‘Sledgehammer’ Could Come For Americans Next
item.description: 'You can say what you like. I don't care, because that's what free speech is, isn’t it?' Nigel Farage responded to rude Rep. Jamie Raskin.

item.title: The Atlantic: Why, Yes, The Point Of Lawfare Is To Overturn Any Elections Republicans Win
item.description: The Atlantic reports the avalanche of leftist lawsuits are cut-and-paste operations designed to overturn election results Democrats don't like.

item.title: Exclusive: Crypto firm Fireblocks launches a stablecoin payments network
item.description: More than 40 companies have joined the network, including Bridge, a stablecoin startup recently acquired by the fintech giant Stripe.

item.title: Why Trump’s Deployment Of The National Guard In California Was Perfectly Legal
item.description: The administration argues, correctly, that the Posse Comitatus Act didn’t apply to President Trump’s deployment of the Guard to California.

item.title: American Universities Are Schooling China on Authoritarian Tactics
item.description: The attempt to limit speech through peer pressure risks turning campuses into surveillance states.

item.title: Cats in Medieval Manuscripts: Prancing, Prowling, and Pounding the Ivories
item.description: In an enchanting new show, Baltimore’s Walters Art Museum looks at cat capers, from comforting the Baby Jesus to routing rats.

item.title: Google stock hits all-time high after government backs down and it has AI rivals to thank
item.description: Alphabet’s stock closed up 8% Thursday at $231.10, its highest level ever.

item.title: Bank of America says the unemployment rate for recent grads is rising faster than all workers
item.description: The report finds that over 13% of unemployed Americans in July were "new entrants" or first-time job-seekers, "which skews towards Gen Z."

item.title: Alabama’s Voter List Costs More Than A New Car
item.description: The Cotton State’s hefty price tag on election transparency — the highest in the nation — is not only wrong, it’s illegal, according to PILF.

item.title: Powerball jackpot hits $1.7 billion, its third-highest prize ever
item.description: The odds of winning the Powerball jackpot are one in 292.2 million, according to official lottery data.

item.title: Don’t Let Ticketmaster Turn Trump’s Reform into a Monopoly Shield
item.description: Real reform shouldn’t mean more central planning.

item.title: After high-profile divorce, Ashley Biden reflects on 'one of the hardest summers'
item.description: Former President Joe Biden's daughter posted on Instagram about facing "one of the hardest summers of my life" after divorce, dad's cancer diagnosis.

item.title: Let’s Stop Repeating The Liberal Line That America Is A ‘Proposition.’ It’s Not
item.description: America is a people and a nation, not an idea, and the hard truth is that not everyone can become an American.

item.title: Google Antitrust Ruling Gets It Right
item.description: The tech industry is simply too chaotic and fast-moving to permit aggressive antitrust action.
